did.unittitle: Tom Van Zoeren oral history collection 1860s-2011 2000-2010
did.abstract: Tom Van Zoeren was a park ranger at Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore. His collection contains oral history interviews relating to the history of the Sleeping Bear Dunes region and other Michigan localities.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Tom Van Zoeren (donor no. 9079) in several accessions beginning in 2001.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Tom Van Zoeren oral history collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Tom Van Zoeren worked as a park ranger at Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore from 1984 to 2005. He conducted oral history interviews with many older residents of the park area.

scopecontent.p: The Van Zoeren collection contains numerous oral history interviews conducted between 1979 and 2010, and also includes copies of scanned photos and other supporting documents. The interviews are available variously on audio cassette tapes, audio compact discs, video DVDs, and online. Transcripts or summaries are found in the collection for many of the interviews. The Van Zoeren collection is organized in two sections by format.

The first section contains analog files and physical media such as CDs and DVDs. This section is arranged in the following series by family interview: Basch/Lanham/Van Zoeren oral history interviews, 1993-2000; George Burfiend oral history interviews, photo collection, and farm tour, 2005-2008; DeKorne family oral history and photographs, 2006; Doan family oral history interview, 2006; Dottie (Ashmore) Lanham oral history and photograph collection, 2003-2008; Alfred and Loraine (Olsen) Mason oral history interview and photo collection, 2001-2004; Leonard Thoreson oral history interview and photos, 2005-2006; and Frederick and Margretha Werner Farm oral history interview and photo collection, 2006-2007. These series contain information related to the families and interviews in the form of text, scanned and printed images, and audio and video recordings.

list.head: Information about selected specific interviews:
list.item: Basch, Laura (Oleson), of the Port Oneida, Mich., area (audio cassettes and online)
Burfiend, George, relating to Burfiend farm and Port Oneida (compact discs, video DVDs, and online)
DeKorne, Jack relating to the family of Boudewyn and Kate DeKorne of Grand Rapids and Glen Lake, Mich. (compact disc and online)
Fargo, Judy Carole and Ruth Ann Doan Jones, relating to the Frank and Alma Doan family of Croswell, Mich. (compact discs and online, filed under Doan family)
Lanham, Dottie, relating to her life and to Burdickville and surrounding area (compact discs and online)
Lanham, John, of Burdickville, Mich. (audio cassettes and online)
Mason, Alfred and Lorraine [referred to as 'Loraine' in some collection materials] (Olsen), relating to their families, the family farms and the Port Oneida community (compact discs and online)
Miller, Charles, relating to the Frederick and Margretha Werner farm in Port Oneida (compact discs, video DVD, and online, filed under Werner)
Stuber, Mary Lou, relating to the Frederick and Margretha Werner farm in Port Oneida. (compact discs and online, filed under Werner)
Thoresen, Leonard, relating to his family, the family farm and the Port Oneida community (compact discs, video DVD, and online)
Thoreson, Leonard, relating to the Frederick and Margretha Werner farm in Port Oneida (video DVD and online, filed under Werner)
Van Noord, Trudy, relating to the family of Boudewyn and Kate DeKorne of Grand Rapids and Glen Lake, Mich. (compact disc and online, filed under DeKorne family)
Van Zoeren, Jay, of Vriesland, Mich., 1948 graduate of the University of Michigan Medical School (audio cassettes and online)

scopecontent.p: Additional files relating to these and other persons were received on a hard drive and are available online.

The second section consists of one series of digitized material, Oral histories, photos, and other historic materials from the Sleeping Bear Dunes region. The digital files were created or assembled by Van Zoeren and were received on an external hard drive. This series is further divided into subseries by type of material: Information on Farms, Families, etc.; Oral History Audio Files; Historic Images; Video Recordings; Genealogies; Census and Cemetery Records; Historic Maps; and Other Resources. Some of the content may be digitized versions of items in the analog portion of the collection.

scopecontent.p: The Information on Farms, Families, etc. subseries (71.3 MB, 1933-2010) contains oral history interview summaries and transcripts as well as correspondence, histories in written forms, and compilations of references to particular farms found in other interviews or documents. Files are arranged geographically by region and area, and then by family or farm.

scopecontent.p: The Oral History Audio Files subseries (35.0 GB, 1976-2010) consists of audio files for oral history interviews, primarily conducted by Tom Van Zoeren. Recordings are arranged geographically by region and area, and then by family or farm. Audio files may be in several formats (original session recordings of the interview or series of interviews, a version divided into tracks, or versions converted to different file formats) and may have been digitized from analog media or born digital.

Port Oneida Fair Oral History Project interviews 2010

scopecontent.p: The Historic Images subseries (7.7 GB, 1860s-2010s) includes images of photographs and postcards as well as documents such as newspaper clippings and marriage or baptismal certificates. Photographs and postcards depict individuals and groups, structures, animals, the land, and other subjects such as ships and trains related to the history of the region and its inhabitants. The original items date from the mid-nineteenth century through the early twenty-first with the bulk dating from the first half of the twentieth century. Images are arranged geographically by region and area, and then by family, farm, or subject. In some cases both original and edited versions of images are included.

scopecontent.p: The Video Recordings subseries (13.7 GB, 1995-2010) contains oral history interviews in video formats, often in the context of a tour of a particular area or farm, as well as videos of various historic sites in the Port Oneida area. Files are arranged by interviewee or topic.

The Genealogies subseries (1.6 GB, 2009-2010) consists of genealogical charts for Port Oneida area families and the DeKorne family. It includes both genealogy software files in GenoPro and GEDCOM formats as well as family trees exported from the software as PDF files.

did.unittitle: DeKorne family genealogy files and family tree
Port Oneida families genealogy files and family trees

scopecontent.p: The Census and Cemetery Records subseries (19.9 MB, 1920 and 2006) contains an image of 1920 Census record for the Glen Arbor township and cemetery record information for the Maple Grove Cemetery and the St. Philip Neri Cemetery in Empire.

did.unittitle: Image of census record for Glen Arbor Township 1920
Lists of cemetery record information for Maple Grove Cemetery and St. Philip Neri Cemetery in Empire 2006

scopecontent.p: The Historic Maps subseries (101 MB, 1881-2009) includes images of maps showing Leelanau County, Glen Arbor, the Port Oneida area, etc.
The Other Resources subseries (37.4 MB, 1995 and 2007-2011) contains collected written and compiled resources on the Sleeping Bear Dunes region, and in particular the Port Oneida area.
